Pies by Copperthite make historic return to Georgetown

In 1886, Henry and Johanna Copperthite came to Georgetown on the eve of Thanksgiving and started baking pies. By 1914, they were baking 60,000 pies a day in Washington, D.C. Their pies were declared the finest in all of America.
